titles.title: Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles (fols. 1ra-182vb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 1ra-1va) I-2) The Preaching of St. Peter (fols. 1vb-13rb) I-3) The Martyrdom of St. Peter (fols. 13rb-16rb) I-4) The Martyrdom of St. Paul, with colophon (fols. 16rb-18va) I-5) The Discourse of Dionysius on the Martyrdom of Sts. Peter and Paul, with colophon (fols. 18vb-27ra) I-6) The Preaching of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 27rb-29ra) I-7) The Martyrdom of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 29ra-29vb) I-8) The Preaching of St. James the Just (fols. 29vb-31rb) I-9) The Martyrdom of St. James the Just (fols. 31rb-34rb) I-10) The Acts of St. Matthias and St. Andrew, presented as Acts of St. Andrew (fols. 34rb-46va) I-11) The Preaching of St. Bartholomew (fols. 47ra-52vb) I-12) The Martyrdom of St. Bartholomew (fols. 52vb-55vb) I-13) The Acts of St. Thomas, I (fols. 55vb-61vb) I-14)The Acts of St. Thomas, II (fols. 62ra-68r) I-15) The Acts of St. Thomas, III (fols. 68rb-73va) I-16) The Acts of St. Thomas, IV (fols. 73va-76va) I-17) The Acts of St. Thomas, V (fols. 76va-80vb) I-18) The Acts of St. Matthew (fols. 80vb-88va) I-19) The Martyrdom of St. Matthew (fols. 88va-90vb) I-20) The Martyrdom of St. Luke (fols. 91ra-94rb) I-21) The Preaching of St. Philip (fols. 94rb-98rb) I-22) The Martyrdom of St. Philip (fols. 98rb-100vb) I-23) The Preaching of St. Andrew (fols. 100vb-109va) I-24) The Martyrdom of St. Andrew (fols. 109va-112va) I-25) The Acts of St. John the Son of Zebedee (fols. 112va-127ra) I-26) The Death of St. John the Son of Zebedee (fols. 127ra-131vb) I-27) The Martyrdom of St. James the Son of Alphaeus (fols. 131vb-132vb) I-28) The Preaching of St. Matthias (fols. 132vb-142rb) I-29) The Martyrdom of St. Matthias (fols. 142rb-144va) I-30) The Acts of St. James the Son of Zebedee (fols. 144va-148va) I-31) The Martyrdom of St. James the Son of Zebedee (fols. 148va-150va) I-32) The Martyrdom of St. Mark the Evangelist (fols. 150va-154va) I-33) The Preaching of St. Thomas (fols. 155vb-175va) I-34) The Martyrdom of St. Thomas (fols. 175va-178rb) I-35) The Preaching of St. Judas Thaddeus (fols. 178rb-182rb) I-36) Dionysius on the tribes of the Apostles, with colophon (fols. 182rb-182vb).

txstates.txstate: The boards have many additional holes; these are possibly traced of unsuccessful and uncertain attempts at to make the sets of holes necessary for binging, possibly by a weak (aged?) or unskilled person (cp. also irregular stitch-chains on the spine). Most of the leaves are cockled (this making the script appear more irregular than it is) Some fols. are affected by humidity; some passages of the text are unreadable (e.g. fols.: 1rv, 2r, 3rv, 4rv, 137rv, 138rv, 139r, 170v, 171r). Holes on many fols. (e.g. fols.: 15, 27, 44, 148, 149). Fols. with holes roughly amended: 56, 67, 92.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown untooled leather (for the most part torn off). Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire: I(8/fols. 1r-8v) – II(8/fols. 9r-16v) – III(8/fols. 17r-24v) – IV(8/fols. 25r-32v) – V(8/fols. 33r-40v) – VI(6/fols. 41r-46v) – VII(8/fols. 47r-54v) – VIII(8/fols. 55r-62v) – IX(8/fols. 63r-70v) – X(8/fols. 71r-78v) – XI(8/fols. 79r-86v) – XII(4/fols. 87r-90v) – XIII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIV(8/fols. 99r-106v) – XV(6/fols. 107r-112v) – XVI(10/fols. 113r-122v) – XVII(7/fols. 123r-129v) – XVIII(8/fols. 130r-137v) – XIX(8/fols. 138r-145v) – XX(8/fols. 146r-153v) – XXI(6/fols. 154r-160v) – XXII(8/fols. 161r-168v) – XXIII(6/fols. 169r-174v) – XXIV(6/fols. 175r-182r).

taunit.mr-info: All data for fol. 89r. The size of margins and columns shows significant variations throughout the Ms.
taunit.ln-info: On average, the number of the lines to a folio is 28-29.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 135r, 137r). Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is above the ruling (in some cases also below it [s. fols.: 62r, 68v, 69r, 88v, 89r, 97v, 98r]). The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; three or four lines in the beginning of each text, alternating with black lines (in one or both columns; only one line in text I-16, fol. 76va, l.9); sometimes the initial three lines of the account proper (but only one line on fol. 109va, l.19); Ethiopic numerals (e.g., fol. 92rb) or their elements (horizontal dashes above and below); elements of the punctuation signs and of the crux ansata.

desccontent.text: I. Gädlä Ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles
desccontent.mss: EMML no. 1482 (15th cent.), fols. 2r-152v: “Combat of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML IV, 606-08; Monastery of Abba Säyfä Mikaʾel, Ṣaʿada Ǝmba Śǝllase, Kärän, Eritrea). EMML no. 1767 (1292/7), fols. 4r-232r: “Combat of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML V, 237-39; Monastery of Ḥayq Ǝsṭifanos, Ambassäl, Wällo). Éthiopien 58 (15th cent.), fols. 1r-162v: “ገድለ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ Gadla Ḥawaryat <Vies des Apôtres>” (AbbCat 69-70. See also CRAbb 69-71, nos. 45,46). Éthiopien 64 (16th cent.), fols. 1r-171v: “ገድለ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ Gadla Ḥawaryat <Vies des Apôtres>” (AbbCat 74-75). Orient. 678 (15th cent.), fols. 1r-171v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 59-62, no. 101). Ṭanasee 173 = Daga Ǝsṭifanos 62 (15th cent.), fols. 1ra-178rb “ገድለ፡ ሐዋርያት። [= Viten der Apostel]” (SixTana III, 226). ZotBNat éth. 52 (14th cent.), fols. 16r-204v: “Actes et martyres des apôtres et évangélistes” (ZotBNat 53-57, no. 33 bis). ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ EMML no. 676 (20th cent.), fols. 1r-255r: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (EMML II, 431-32; Patriarchate Library, quarter of Mäkkakäläña, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 813 (1944/5), fols. 1r-236r: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (EMML III, 128-29; Church of the Apostles, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 2406 (1775/1809), fols. 3r-124r: “Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML VI, 469; Church of Afär Bayne Täklä Haymanot, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4442 (18th cent.), fols. 3r-161r: “Combat of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML X, 156-57; Church of Sälla Dǝngay, Moǧa and Wädärra, Shoa). Orient. 683 (17th cent.), fols. 1r-254v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 62-65, no. 102). Orient. 681 (1705/6), fols. 1r-196v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 65-66, no. 103). Orient. 680 (1711/12), fols. 1r-193v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 66-67, no. 104). Orient. 682 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-195v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 67, no. 105). Orient. 677 (1764/5), fols. 1r-199v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 67-69, no. 106). Orient. 679 (1785/86), fols. 1r-183v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 69-70, no. 107). literature.text: A. Bausi; “Ḥawaryat: Gädlä ḥawaryat”, in: EAE II, 1049-51. ID., “I manoscritti etiopici di J.M. Wansleben nella Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenze”, RSE 33, 1989 [1991], 5-33. BauGaH. CANT, s. Index. I. Guidi, “Gli Atti apocrifi degli Apostoli nei testi copti, arabi ed etiopici”, Giornale della società Asiatica Italiana 2, 1888, 1-66. F. Morard, “Acts of the Apostles”, in: CE I, 58-61.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 1ra (Introduction): In the Name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. This (is) the book of the rule of the Apostles and of others among 72 lesser Disciples, and of all from their story that was in every country, and of the record (of those) of them who (suffered) the martyrdom and of those of them who died. May their prayer and their blessing take care of us, of all of us, Christian people. [Forever and] ever. Amen. ....  ]fol. 1va, l.17] With thanks of the Lord and with the help of the Lord Jesus Christ, we begin [to write] the preaching of the blessed [saint] Peter, the chosen chief of the Apostles…
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 182va, l.30 (Dionysius on the tribes of the Apostles): …ወአኰቴት፡ ለመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘ[fol. 182vb]ወሀቦሙ፡ ጥበበ፡ ወአእምሮ፡ ከመ፡ ይስ[n.l.] ውስተ፡ ኵሉ፡ አጽ[n.l.] ዓለም፡ በእንተ፡ ቅድስት፡ ሥላሴ፡ ፩[n.l.]ላክ፡ ሎቱ፡ ስብሐት፡ ወክብር፡ ወዕበይ፡ እስከ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወአሜን፨ ለዘ፡ ጸሐፎ ወለዘ፡ አን[n.l.] ወለዘ፡ ተርጐሞ፡ ለዘሰምዐ፡ ቃላቲሁ፡ በአሚን፡ ወበርትዕ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ሕቡረ፡ [n.l.]ሐሮሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ለዓለም፡ አሜን፨
desccontent.etranslation:
Fol. 182va, l.30 (Dionysius on the tribes of the Apostles): … And thanks-giving [be] to the Holy Spirit Who gave them knowledge and understanding so that [n.l.] in all [n.l.] the world concerning the Holy Trinity, one [God], to Whom [be] glory and honour and majesty, forever and ever. Amen. Amen.

And for the one who wrote it and for whom [n.l.] and for the one who interpreted it, for the one who listened to its words in the belief and in the right faith, the Lord [be] in unison [n.l.], in the Reign of the Heavens. Forever. Amen.
desccontent.details:
For each text, the equivalent pages of Budge's Edition (BConAp I, II) and the abbreviations used by Bausi in Annali 2000-2001 are given here following:

I-1) BConAp I, 3-6; BConAp II, 2-3; Int in BauGaH

I-2) BConAp I, 7-36; BConAp II, 5-25; Pt1 in BauGaH

I-3) BConAp I, 37-41, 45-49; BConAp II, 26-34; Pt2 in BauGaH

I-4) BConAp I, 42-45; BConAp II, 35-39; Pa1 in BauGaH

I-5) BConAp I, 50-66; BConAp II, 42-57; Dio in BauGaH

I-6) BConAp I, 67-70; BConAp II, 58-61; Si1 in BauGaH

I-7) BConAp I, 70-72; BConAp II, 62-64; Si2 in BauGaH

I-8) BConAp I, 73-76; BConAp II, 65-68; Jc1 in BauGaH

I-9) BConAp I, 76-82; BConAp II, 69-75; Jc2 in BauGaH

I-10) BConAp I, 307-35; BConAp II, 307-34; MAn in BauGaH

I-11) BConAp I, 83-92; BConAp II, 76-86; Ba1 in BauGaH

I-12) BConAp I, 93-100; BConAp II, 87-92; Ba2 in BauGaH

I-13) BConAp I, 336-46; BConAp II, 335-46; Th3 in BauGaH

I-14) BConAp I, 347-57; BConAp II, 347-57; Th4 in BauGaH

I-15) BConAp I, 358-67; BConAp II, 358-65; Th5 in BauGaH

I-16) BConAp I, 368-73; BConAp II, 366-75; Th6 in BauGaH

I-17) BConAp I, 373-81; BConAp II, 376-84; Th7 in BauGaH

I-18) BConAp I, 101-13; BConAp II, 93-108; Mt1 in BauGaH

I-19) BConAp I, 114-18; BConAp II, 109-14; Mt2 in BauGaH

I-20) BConAp I, 119-25; BConAp II, 115-21; Luc in BauGaH

I-21) BConAp I, 126-34; BConAp II, 122-30; Ph1 in BauGaH

I-22) BConAp I, 135-39; BConAp II, 131-36; Ph2 in BauGaH

I-23) BConAp I, 140-56; BConAp II, 137-53; An1 in BauGaH

I-24) BConAp I, 184-88; BConAp II, 181-85; An2 in BauGaH

I-25) BConAp I, 189-213; BConAp II, 186-211; Jo1 in BauGaH

I-26) BConAp I, 214-22; BConAp II, 212-20; Jo2 in BauGaH

I-27) BConAp I, 223-24; BConAp II, 221-22; JcA in BauGaH

I-28) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH

I-29) BConAp I, 243-246; BConAp II, 241-45; Ma2 in BauGaH

I-30) BConAp I, 247-53; BConAp II, 246-52; JZ1 in BauGaH

I-31) BConAp I, 254-57; BConAp II, 253-56; JZ2 in BauGaH

I-32) BConAp I, 257-64; BConAp II, 257-64; Mar in BauGaH

I-33) BConAp I, 265-87; BConAp II, 265-86; Th1 in BauGaH

I-34) BConAp I, 287-95; BConAp II, 287-95; Th2 in BauGaH

I-35) BConAp I, 296-306; BConAp II, 296-306; Jud in BauGaH

I-36) BConAp I, 49-50; BConAp II, 40-41; Ap1 in BauGaH

- According to the distribution of the texts, the Gädlä ḥawaryat of MY-004 would belong to the IV recension’s group (cp. BauGaH, 83-84).
Text I-3, the "Martyrdom of St. Peter", does not contain the "Discourse of Peter on the Cross" (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34).

extras.extra: - On fol. 1r, two ruled lines at the bottom left empty (probably the space left for ornamental band). - Omitted word is written interlineally on fol. 61va, in the main hand. - Omitted passage or supplication (?) is written in the margin of fol. 142v, in the main hand. - Fol. 182vb (below the text): Short note referring to the number of parchment leaves: ፻፺ወ፫ብራና። "193 parchment leaves" (but the currenf number of fols. is 182). - Words or numbers (cues for the rubricator) written in the margins of the column, repeating the rubricated words in the text: e.g., fols. 98r, 100v, 112v, 114r, 124v, 175v, 182ra.
